isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - MAINTENANCE - BP-R1 INSPECTION TEST

svcproc.title: BP-R1 INSPECTION TEST

step1.para: Charge the air brake system to a minimum of 100 psi air pressure.
Release the tractor park brake by pushing in the yellow, diamond shaped park brake knob.
Deactivate the trailer brake control system by pulling out the red (octagonal-shaped) trailer air supply knob.
Apply the brakes by partially depressing the brake pedal (treadle) and hold the pedal in this partially-depressed position.
The observer should note the movement (stroke) of the rear slack adjusters and the position of the yoke-pin in the slack adjuster.
With the brake pedal in the partially-depressed position, push the red (octagonal-shaped) trailer brake control knob in to activate the trailer brake control system.
The observer should observe a further movement (increased stroke) of the rear slack adjusters and yoke-pin.

svcproc.para: The rear slack adjusters and yoke pins should move away from the chamber as a result of the partial brake application in step 4 and then move further away from the chamber (longer stroke) after the trailer brake control is applied in step 6. These two reactions confirm that the rear brakes operate at reduced pressure when the tractor is operating without a trailer (bobtail mode) and operate at full pressure when the tractor is coupled to a trailer.
If the performance of the BP-R1 is not as described, perform the OPERATION and LEAKAGE TESTS described in SERVICE CHECKS.
